text: Wat Zom Khum (; also spelt Wat Jong Kham) is a 15th-century Buddhist temple in Kengtung, Shan State, Myanmar (Burma). The temple's pagoda, which stands high, contains six strands of the Buddha's hair. == References == Category:Buddhist temples in Myanmar Category:Buildings and structures in Shan State Category:15th-century Buddhist temples Category:Religious buildings and structures completed in the 1400s
title: Wat Zom Khum
